channel.title: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/
channel.description:
Dear people,
These days, I'm currently developing my new server: SlaveScape. It's going great, everything works out as it should.
But...
I want to host my server soon, but I'm dealing with a big problem:
I have [b]TP-Link WR1043ND[/b] router, and an [b]Allied Data CopperJet 1616-2P[/b] router.
Configuration of the TP-Link WR1043ND:
[b]LAN[/b] [i]MAC Address: F8-D1-11-24-72-F8 IP Address: 192.168.1.1 Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0[/i]
[b]WAN[/b] [i]MAC Address: F8-D1-11-24-72-F9 IP Address: 172.19.3.2 Static IP Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0 Default Gateway: 172.19.3.1 DNS Server: 172.19.3.1 , 0.0.0.0[/i]
Configuration of the CopperJet 1616-2P:
[b]LAN[/b] [i]LAN IP Address 172.19.3.1 LAN Subnet Mask: 255.255.0.0 IP Address Type: Static MAC Address: 00:01:71:0E:B5:BE[/i]
[b]WAN[/b] [i]WAN IP Address: 93.125.135.106
WAN Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.255
IP Address Type: Dynamic, from PPP
Default Gateway: 0.0.0.0
Primary DNS: 217.149.196.6 resolve10.dns.internl.net
Secondary DNS: 217.149.192.6 resolve20.dns.internl.net[/i]
The problem now is, is that I need to open a port at the CopperJet with the IP-adress starting at: 172.19.3.X but on my local lan I'm at 192.168.1.X
And everytime I want to open the port 43594 with the IP-adress 192.168.1.X it gives an error because it isn't starting with 172.19.3.X
Can anyone please help me? I'm desperate :/

item.title: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/
item.dc:creator: @SlaveScape SlaveScape
item.description:
@SlaveScape wrote:

[quote=“12igon8, post:4, topic:476465”]This kind of stuff is probably going to get solved faster/better by using google.

Or try going to http://portforward.com[/quote]

Yeah thanks. Don’t you think I haven’t tried that yet bro? I spend 4 days googling to find answers. But what PvPXile said; trying to host it over one. I’m gonna check and see if that works out.

Anyhow,

Thanks everyone for your support already!

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/

item.title: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/

item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

Why dont you just use one?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/
item.dc:creator: @12igon8 12igon8
item.description:
@12igon8 wrote:

This kind of stuff is probably going to get solved faster/better by using google.

Or try going to http://portforward.com

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/

item.title: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/
item.dc:creator: @SlaveScape SlaveScape
item.description:
@SlaveScape wrote:

[quote=“lotto320, post:2, topic:476465”]Configure both the routers to be on the same subnet eg. 192.168.1.1 and 192.168.1.2.

Also, make it so one of the routers gives out DHCP, not both.[/quote]

Thank you for your fast responding! I tried your method, but putting them on the same subnet gave me an error in the TP-Link router:

TPLink_Before.jpg1022×575

TPLink.jpg1022×575

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/

item.title: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/
item.dc:creator: @lotto320 lotto320
item.description:
@lotto320 wrote:

Configure both the routers to be on the same subnet eg. 192.168.1.1 and 192.168.1.2.

Also, make it so one of the routers gives out DHCP, not both.

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting a RSPS with 2 Routers... Please help me out :/

@SlaveScape wrote:

Dear people,

These days, I’m currently developing my new server: SlaveScape.
It’s going great, everything works out as it should.

But…

I want to host my server soon, but I’m dealing with a big problem:

I have TP-Link WR1043ND router, and an Allied Data CopperJet 1616-2P router.

Configuration of the TP-Link WR1043ND:

LAN
MAC Address:
F8-D1-11-24-72-F8
IP Address:
192.168.1.1
Subnet Mask:
255.255.255.0

WAN
MAC Address: F8-D1-11-24-72-F9
IP Address: 172.19.3.2 Static IP
Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0
Default Gateway: 172.19.3.1
DNS Server: 172.19.3.1 , 0.0.0.0

LAN
LAN IP Address
172.19.3.1
LAN Subnet Mask:
255.255.0.0

MAC Address:
00:01:71:0E:B5:BE

WAN
[i]WAN IP Address:
93.125.135.106

WAN Subnet Mask:
255.255.255.255

IP Address Type:
Dynamic, from PPP

Default Gateway:
0.0.0.0

Primary DNS:
217.149.196.6
resolve10.dns.internl.net

Secondary DNS:
217.149.192.6
resolve20.dns.internl.net[/i]

The problem now is, is that I need to open a port at the CopperJet with the IP-adress starting at: 172.19.3.X
but on my local lan I’m at 192.168.1.X

And everytime I want to open the port 43594 with the IP-adress 192.168.1.X it gives an error because it isn’t starting
with 172.19.3.X

Can anyone please help me? I’m desperate
